intro: Callianthe rufivela, commonly known as the red-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a velvety texture and a deep red or purple hue, which contrast beautifully with its white or pink flowers. Callianthe rufivela is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant appearance and adaptability to warm climates.
